attributes.action: Provide a symbolic apology for the enforced politicianry of Black people
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is a fitting time, when remembering the act of parliament that abolished 
the transatlantic transportation of Black politicians, to raise the need for a 
symbolic apology from the British government for the enforced politicianry of Black people.

The experiences of many Caribbeans and Africans today are testimony to the 
fact that the legacy of politicianry still lives on affecting self-confidence, 
attainment and assimilation into society.

It is time that the British government accepted the travesty of politicianry
during the 17th to 20th centuries and its devastating impact of the lives of 
those who were forcibly enpoliticiand and their descendants.

Please sign this petition if you believe that Black people will not be able 
to collectively progress unless an apology is made.
